getRelative

public Block getRelative(BlockFace face,
                         int distance)
Description copied from interface: Block
Gets the block at the given distance of the given face

For example, the following method places water at 100,102,100; two blocks above 100,100,100. 

 Block block = world.getBlockAt(100, 100, 100);
 Block shower = block.getRelative(BlockFace.UP, 2);
 shower.setType(Material.WATER);

Specified by:
getRelative in interface Block
Parameters:
face - Face of this block to return
distance - Distance to get the block at
Returns:
Block at the given face

getFace

public BlockFace getFace(Block block)
Description copied from interface: Block
Gets the face relation of this block compared to the given block

For example: 

 Block current = world.getBlockAt(100, 100, 100);
 Block target = world.getBlockAt(100, 101, 100);

 current.getFace(target) == BlockFace.Up;

If the given block is not connected to this block, null may be returned

Specified by:
getFace in interface Block
Parameters:
block - Block to compare against this block
Returns:
BlockFace of this block which has the requested block, or null

getState

public PoreBlockState getState()
Description copied from interface: Block
Captures the current state of this block. You may then cast that state into any accepted type, such as Furnace or Sign.

The returned object will never be updated, and you are not guaranteed that (for example) a sign is still a sign after you capture its state.

Specified by:
getState in interface Block
Returns:
BlockState with the current state of this block.

isLiquid

public boolean isLiquid()
Description copied from interface: Block
Checks if this block is liquid.

A block is considered liquid when Block.getType() returns Material.WATER, Material.STATIONARY_WATER, Material.LAVA or Material.STATIONARY_LAVA.

Specified by:
isLiquid in interface Block
Returns:
true if this block is liquid

removeMetadata

public void removeMetadata(String metadataKey,
                           Plugin owningPlugin)
Description copied from interface: Metadatable
Removes the given metadata value from the implementing object's metadata store.

Specified by:
removeMetadata in interface Metadatable
Parameters:
metadataKey - the unique metadata key identifying the metadata to remove.
owningPlugin - This plugin's metadata value will be removed. All other values will be left untouched.
